intro: Cryptangium strictum, commonly known as the rigid cryptangium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often displaying shades of white or pale pink. Cryptangium strictum is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for native pollinators.
